What to Do

Use a valid TLS certificate.

Why

Using a valid TLS certificate helps prevent Man-In-The-Middle attacks and assures the visitor that your site is secure and trusted.

When

Use valid TLS certificates for all high value web applications. Self-signed certificates may be acceptable for personal sites and sites that don't handle sensitive information.

How

To use a valid TLS certificate:

  1. Purchase a valid TLS certificate. You may purchase a valid TLS key from Verisign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the TLS certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file.

  2. Import the valid TLS certificate. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Select the server in the left pane. Double-click on the "Server Certificates" icon in the right pane. Click on "Complete Certificate Request..." in the right-most pane. Click the "..." button to navigate to the .cer file that you have purchased. Enter the name of your site as the "Friendly name". Click "OK" to install the certificate.

  3. Create HTTPS bindings. Start the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". Right-click on each site and select "Edit bindings...". Add a binding of the "https" type.

Additional Resources

  • For more information about installing a TLS certificate, please see "IIS SSL Certificate Installation" at http://www.digicert.com/ssl-certificate-installation-microsoft-iis-7.htm
